alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cherokee; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cherokee, southwestern Pickens and east central Bartow Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Sutallee, or 8 miles east of Cartersville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Canton, Cartersville, Emerson, Waleska, George Washington Carver St Pk, Lake Arrowhead, Salacoa Valley, Red Top Mountain State Park, Talmadge and Sutallee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
